page.title: 12HORTICULTURAL SHOW
page.content: First held 1884. Popular annual event ( 3rd Saturday in August) supported by local gardeners & craftsmen. Has horticultural, floral - art, crafts, domestic & children's sections. On 17th August 1985, after weeks of poor weather , bright day brought many visitors to the Endowed School to see the show and watch the sports. This year it was too costly to have the usual band & fancy-dress parade. 860 exhibits ( 143 from children ) were displayed by 121 exhibitors . High standard was reached throughout. Trophies, diplomas, seedsmen's awards, special & money prizes were presented by the President during the afternoon. Expenses are high and there is always a loss on the Show, reduced somewhat by profits on a plant stall & teas. Smaller shows are held twice yearly, mainly for the Society's 100 members.
